summary: All four iteration-1 blocking issues are addressed with concrete scope normalization, a non-breaking parser change plus verified consumer inventory, explicit metric tracking, and deterministic --strict tests; no new truly blocking problems introduced.

previous_issues_status.original_issue: Scope accounting inconsistent (claimed 14+8 but acceptance said 14+4; index only listed 4 second-round items)
previous_issues_status.notes: Overview now consistently states 14 + 4 = 18, explicitly notes the other 4 PR#57 second-round findings were handled in cycle-016, and the Findings Index enumerates the 4 in-scope PR#57 second-round items (F9s/F10s/F15s/F16s). This makes acceptance deterministically checkable.

previous_issues_status.original_issue: Breaking interface change risk: TAGGED output format change not fully accounting for all consumers/tests
previous_issues_status.notes: Task 1.2 keeps the callback signature unchanged and moves end-line via shared variable `para_end`, avoiding a shared-component interface break. It also adds an explicit grep-based consumer inventory showing TAGGED is internal to check-provenance.sh, with provenance-stats.sh and run-tests.sh not parsing TAGGED. That is a sufficient dependency accounting for this change.

previous_issues_status.original_issue: F7 not actually implemented (triage â‰  tracked metric); missing explicit task to record/report unqualified INFERRED metric
previous_issues_status.notes: Task 2.2 explicitly adds `metrics.unqualified_inferred_count` to JSONL snapshots, includes per-document counts, adds a configurable threshold via read-config.sh, and integrates with --strict. Triage is correctly separated into Task 2.3.

previous_issues_status.original_issue: --strict mode acceptance criteria underspecified (missing_docs definition/source-of-truth and deterministic tests)
previous_issues_status.notes: Task 2.1 now defines the source of truth (generation-manifest.json .documents[].path), defines `missing_docs`, and includes 4 deterministic acceptance tests covering strict/non-strict exit codes and JSON field presence.
